column4: Do people use IRC as IM (meaning for just chatting, not about anything in particular)? If so, what server/room is used for that?
#defocus or #ubuntu-offtopic
no
which programming language?
#ubuntu-offtopic might be of more help
dhclient deals with resolv.conf using the information it gets from your dhcp server
and yes, if you're using /etc/network/interfaces you should remove network manager. It's not supposed to interfere, but it sometimes does.
remove, or can I simply disable somehow at first to make sure all works ok?
no idea about 1), but 2) would be "sudo apt-get purge network-manager" (and say yes if it complains that it has to remove network-manager-gnome)
point well taken, but still at least it's all setup in one place (my pfSense box which controls PS3 and several client PCs) as opposed to each of several clients.
seahorse-plugins adds the gedit plugin, iirc
oh. I didn't know that. thanks.
it used to be installed by default; there was some reason for changing that that I forget
just installed seahorse-plugins. That added encrypt/decrypt to file context menu in nautilus. Thanks again! I needed that.
Awesome, it enables me to add the "Clipboard Text Encryption" applet to the list of applets I can put on the panel, also. I really wanted that but thought it disappeared after jaunty.
sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop
randomOfAmber , so is it gnome-desktop or ubuntu-desktop?
no
so what needs them uses them, otherwise no big deal having them installed and available?
correct
thank you very much.
